thread.title: Last Day of New York Comic-Con 2015 (PHOTOS)
thread.title_full: Last Day of New York Comic-Con 2015 (PHOTOS)

author: Aristide Economopoulos | NJ Advance Media, for NJ.com
title: Last Day of New York Comic-Con 2015 (PHOTOS)
text:
Comments 
NEW YORK - Sunday was the last day of the New York Comic-Con 2015, which ran from Thursday through Sunday. Celebrating its 10th year, there has been such a big demand that in addition to the show at the Javits Center, it has expanded to utilize the nearby Hammerstein Ballroom to highlight TV programing by a number of networks. 
The show was expected to draw in more than 150,000 fans with having nearly 1,000 exhibitors. There will be panel discussions, signings, merchandise for sale plus meet-and-greets with actors, authors and artists with their fans. 
This year there were a couple of panels that had a buzz around them. More space was allotted to host panels on "The Walking Dead," a revival of "The X-Files" after a 13 year hiatus and a panel for Batman fans on the 30th Anniversary of DC Comics "The Dark Knight Returns." 
Although tickets for the four-day event were sold out, fans watched the New York Comic-Con 2015 live stream at the NYCC website .
